intro: Corispermum chinganicum, commonly known as the Chinese sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of China. It is a member of the Chenopodiaceae family, which includes many salt-tolerant species. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and are arranged in dense clusters. Corispermum chinganicum is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
